newsitem.title: USA: Clarify stock plunges on sales warning.
newsitem.headline: Clarify stock plunges on sales warning.

text.p: The stock of Clarify Inc. lost more than 58 percent of its value Wednesday, one day after the software maker warned that it expected little revenue growth in the second quarter this year.
Clarify plunged $9.75 to $7 in heavy trading of 7.7 million shares on the Nasdaq market.

The San Jose, Calif.-based company Tuesday reported first-quarter earnings of $1.95 million, or 9 cents a share, up from $868,000, or 4 cents a share, a year earlier. Revenues rose to $19.36 million from $8.95 million in the first quarter of 1996.
The company said it it saw "little, if any, revenue growth rate for the second quarter over the first quarter in 1997."
The company did not provide additional details for the revenue forecast.
